intro: Jossinia schlechteri, commonly known as the Schlechter's jossia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
